measured_by: Gamified effort-based decision-making task with computational modelling parameter
justification: Participants "completed a gamified effort-based decision-making task online" and the "winning model… entailed three free parameters… motivational tendency (overall decision bias towards exerting effort)", indicating that motivational tendency was operationalised through a parameter extracted from this task.
"Additionally, we assessed diabetes risk using the FINDRISC 20," demonstrating that the FINDRISC questionnaire was used to quantify participants’ metabolic/diabetes risk.
The methods state: "We assessed psychiatric variables using … the Apathy Evaluation Scale (AES) 22," showing that apathy was measured with the AES.
The article notes: "We assessed psychiatric variables using the Snaith-Hamilton Anhedonia Rating Scale (SHAPS) 21," identifying SHAPS as the instrument for anhedonia.
"To target circadian rhythm, we included the Morningness-Eveningness Questionnaire (MEQ) 23," indicating MEQ was used to assess circadian rhythm.
The same sentence reports that the study also used "the Munich Chronotype Questionnaire (MCTQ) 24" to measure aspects of circadian rhythm/chronotype.
During screening, physical activity was recorded "using the International Physical Activity Questionnaire - short form (IPAQ) 19," showing IPAQ served as the measure of physical activity.
